TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine, smectitic, mesic Natric Duraquolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Scherrard clay loam, irrigated pasture.  (Colors are for moist soil unless otherwise noted.)
Ap--5 to 10 inches; black (10YR 2/1) clay loam, (10YR 5/1) dry; weak thin platy structure parting to moderate very fine angular blocky; hard, firm, very sticky and very plastic; many very fine roots; many very fine pores; strongly alkaline (pH 8.6); abrupt wavy boundary.  (3 to 12 inches thick)
A--5 to 10 inches; black (10YR 2/1) silty clay, gray (10YR 5/1) dry; moderate fine angular blocky structure; hard, firm, very sticky and very plastic; many very fine roots; common very fine tubular pores; strongly effervescent in spots; strongly alkaline (pH 8.6); clear wavy boundary.  (3 to 15 inches thick)
Btk--10 to 21 inches; black (10YR 2/1) silty clay, gray (10YR 5/1) dry; gray (10YR 6/1) rubbed and dry; weak medium prismatic structure parting to moderate fine angular blocky; very hard, very firm, very sticky and very plastic; common very fine roots; common very fine tubular pores; many cutans on surfaces of peds; strongly effervescent, common grayish brown (10YR 5/2) lime spots and patches; strongly alkaline (pH 9.0); abrupt smooth boundary.  (5 to 18 inches thick)
Bkqm1--21 to 27 inches; very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) duripan light brownish gray (10YR 6/2) and light gray (10YR 7/1) dry; platy, very hard, very firm; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) laminar, opaline cap 1 to 2 millimeters thick at top of pan; thin opaline coatings on plate surfaces; strongly effervescent; strongly alkaline (pH 8.8); clear wavy boundary.  (4 to 24 inches thick)
Bkqm2--27 to 33 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) duripan; light gray (10YR 7/1) dry; massive; very hard, firm and brittle; slightly effervescent; moderately alkaline (pH 8.4); clear wavy boundary.  (0 to 15 inches thick)
C--33 to 60 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) sandy loam, light gray (10YR 7/1) dry; massive; slightly hard, friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; many very fine pores; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Klamath County, Oregon; 1,850 feet east and 1,600 feet south of the northwest corner section 27, T. 39 S., R. 11.5 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Mean annual soil temperature ranges from 48 to 50 degrees F.  Exchangeable sodium exceeds 15 percent in all or part of the upper 20 inches of the profile, decreasing with increasing depth below 20 inches.  The soil is calcareous in all parts at depths between 10 and 40 inches.  Depth to the duripan ranges from 20 to 40 inches but depths between 20 to 30 inches predominate.
The A horizon has value of 2 or 3 moist, 4 or 5 dry and chroma of 0 to 1 moist and dry.  It is clay loam, silty clay loam, silt loam, or very fine sandy loam.
The Btk horizon has hue of neutral, 10YR or 2.5Y, value of 2 or 3 moist, 4 through 6 dry, and chroma of 0 through 2 moist and dry.  This horizon commonly has many segregated lime masses and is strongly or very strongly alkaline.  It averages 35 to 45 percent clay and has stress cutans on surfaces of peds.
The duripan is weakly to strongly cemented, commonly platy, and has either some opal coatings on plate surfaces or a laminar opaline cap of 1 or 2 millimeters or both.  The duripan commonly is 4 to 24 inches thick.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  This is the Whipple series.  Whipple soils have a mean annual soil temperature of 52 to 54 degrees F., has an E horizon, and is poorly drained.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Scherrard soils are on low terraces at elevations of 4,050 to 4,725 feet.  Slopes are 0 to 1 percent.  The soils formed in mixed sediments weathered mainly from tuffs and diatomite.  The climate is characterized by cool, wet winters and hot dry summers.  The mean annual precipitation is 10 to 15 inches.  The mean annual temperature is about 46 to 49 degrees F., and the frost-free period is about 80 to 110 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the competing Hosley soils and the Henley, Malin, and Lakeview soils.  Henley soils have an ochric epipedon and have loam or sandy loam texture in all parts of the profile.  Malin soils lack a duripan to depths of more than 60 inches.  Lakeview soils are nonsodic and also lack a duripan.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Somewhat poorly drained; very slow runoff; slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Irrigated barley and pasture, native wet meadow hay and pasture, and wildlife habitat.  Native plants are Baltic rush, inland saltgrass, and meadow barley.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Basins in south-central Oregon.  The series is moderately extensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Davis, California

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  This draft reflects a change in classification from a fine, montmorillionitic (calcareous), mesic Natric Duraquolls to a fine, montmorillonitic, mesic Natric Duraquolls.
Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon:
Mollic epipedon - from surface to 10 inches (Ap and A horizons).  Natric horizon - 10 to 21 inches (Btk horizon).
Duripan - 21 to 33 inches (Bkqm1 and Bkqm2 horizons).
